algorithm_technique: Dynamic programming with state representing floor index and number of carpets used.
problem_summary_simple: Minimize visible white tiles by covering a floor with a limited number of carpets.
problem_summary_technical: Uses 2D DP where dp[i][j] is min white tiles in first i floors using j carpets.
key_insights: This problem can be framed as a DP problem where we decide whether to place a carpet or not at each step.
The state needs to capture the current position on the floor and the number of carpets remaining.
The transitions involve either not placing a carpet (extending the previous state) or placing a carpet (jumping back `carpetLen` positions).
